{include "default_salutation"} –

For more than two years now, Pennsylvania lawmakers have been working on legislation to reform the state's broken probation system, a system that is one of the biggest drivers of mass incarceration in the commonwealth.

Unfortunately, these efforts have been derailed again and again as politicians in Harrisburg strip away the most important elements of probation reform. With the introduction of S.B.913 in the state Senate, it's beginning to feel like Groundhog Day when it comes to state legislators backing fake probation "reform."

Tell your state senator to vote NO on S.B.913, which would only deepen the probation crisis in the commonwealth.

Contact your Senator

S.B.913 fails to limit the time a person can be sentenced to probation. It would allow judges to keep people on probation until they have paid their restitution in full. A person living in poverty who has fulfilled all of their probation terms could nevertheless find themselves on probation indefinitely simply because they cannot afford to pay.

And, like every aspect of the criminal legal system, S.B.913 would deepen, not alleviate, the racial biases in a system that disproportionately impacts Black and brown Pennsylvanians.

A vote on S.B.913 could come as soon as Monday. With that vote, the opportunity to meaningfully address the state's probation crisis will be lost.

Will you contact your state senator and urge them to vote 'No' on S.B.913?

Thanks for sticking with us,
